page.title: 17The old days in Worle
page.content: We went to a lady who has lived in Worle all her life. She told us some information. Along Hill Road were lots of market gardens selling vegetables. Also there used to be a railway track along Station Road which is how it got its name. Worle was mostly bare fields and small farms. Children didn't have entertainment then. They didn't have slides or swings. They used to have to make up their own games. In Worle at that time they didn't have taps; they had pumps which were called the village pumps. The pump in Worle was opposite the Woodspring Pub.They had to get the water from the pump and carry it back in a yoke. There were also wells which were in peoples back gardens.The milkman came twice a day seven days a week.The lady said that she liked the old days better than the modern.
